business.headline: Old tax regime gets a boost. Does it work better for you than the new one?Handcrafted ByOur Editors If you have moved on to the new income tax regime, should you give the old one another look after the proposed benefits? Read on to see what the changes could mean for your tax savings.

India is catching up fast with US, China in AI race: IndiaAI CEO Abhishek SinghIn an exclusive interview following the Grand AI India Impact Summit, Abhishek Singh, CEO of India's Mission AI, discusses the nation's emerging role in the global artificial intelligence landscape.

Brazilian President Lula says India and Brazil can trade without relying on US dollarAs Brazil looks to deepen ties with India, Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva signals a future where the two economies trade more, rely less on the US dollar, and build a partnership driven by growth, technology and trust.

No debates within BRICS to create new currency: Brazil's Lula to India TodayIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva clarified there is no BRICS currency plan, but said India and Brazil can still rethink dollar-based trade and slowly build alternatives.

Can you open multiple PPF accounts? Here's the answerThe Public Provident Fund (PPF) is one of India's most trusted long-term savings options, thanks to its tax benefits, steady returns and government backing. Many investors, however, wonder if it's possible to open more than one PPF account to save more.

SIPs in crypto? What they are and how to get startedCrypto is often linked with sharp price swings and high risk. SIPs, on the other hand, are associated with steady, long-term investing. So what happens when these two very different ideas come together? That is where the conversation around crypto SIPs begins.

Exclusive: AI is like a tsunami hitting jobs market, warns IMF's chiefAccording to Georgieva, AI can boost growth and raise incomes. However, if not handled carefully, it can deepen inequality and unsettle workers.

Sensex ends over 300 points higher, Nifty gains despite market volatilityThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 316.57 points to end at 82,814.71, while the Nifty50 gained 116.90 points to settle at 25,571.25. Broader market indices also recovered well through the afternoon, lifting overall sentiment.

Gold jumps nearly Rs 1,000, silver surges Rs 4,000: Time to invest or wait for a dip?After several weeks of uncertainty, gold and silver are now moving higher with steady gains. This has boosted market sentiment, but it has also left many wondering whether to buy now or wait for more favourable prices.

How Hyderabad's love for biryani exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scamIn India, biryani is more than food. It is an emotion that finally left a trail too big to hide. Read on to find out how it exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scam.

8th Pay Commission: When will you get your arrears and salary hike?Central government employees and pensioners are closely watching every update on the 8th Pay Commission. The big questions remain, i.e., when will the new pay structure be implemented, and when will arrears actually reach your bank account?

IMF chief says India well-positioned in AI race thanks to digital infrastructureAccording to Kristalina Georgieva, India is in a strong position due to its early investment in digital public infrastructure, which now forms the base for wider AI access.

How a biryani billing trail exposed tax scam; Rs 70,000 crore sales hiddenWhat began as a simple I-T review of biryani restaurant bills turned into a sweeping hunt for Rs 70,000 crore in suppressed sales buried across the country.

Why has this Dutch company's stock gained over 90% on Nasdaq in six months?ASML Holding's stock has gained 94.66% in the past six months on the US stock exchange Nasdaq, where many of the world's biggest technology companies list their shares.

Infosys, Tech Mahindra, TCS: Why IT stocks are falling again todayThe slide in IT stocks raises fresh questions about what is spooking investors and how long this uneasy phase could last. A closer look may reveal more than the morning numbers suggest.

Sensex, Nifty open flat amid volatility, IT stocks continue to declineWith global cues expected to remain volatile, investors are likely to stay cautious. Movements in crude oil, the rupee and developments in the US–Iran standoff will remain key drivers for market direction through the day.

UK and India must shape AI together, says Kanishka NarayanIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, UK AI Minister Kanishka Narayan highlighted the strengthening technological partnership between India and the United Kingdom.

BNW Developments partners with Radisson Hotel Group for hotel and residencesThe development will include the Radisson Blu Hotel, RAK Central, with 361 rooms, and Radisson Blu Residences, RAK Central, with 222 branded homes.
India well-positioned to lead in AI: Sam Altman at AI Impact SummitOpenAI CEO Sam Altman hailed India's rapid progress in 'sovereign AI' and said it's well-positioned to lead in AI.
Sensex closes 1,236 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; IndiGo down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1,236.11 points to close at 82,498.14, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 365 points to end at 25,454.35.

entertainment.headline: Anushka Sharma, Virat Kohli back in Mumbai after Alibaug break. Watch Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli were clicked at Mumbai's Gateway of India ferry terminal as they returned from their Alibaug getaway. Videos of the two arriving at the ferry terminal have gone viral.

Scum of the world: Javed Akhtar condemns Taliban after new law permits wife beating Veteran lyricist and screenwriter Javed Akhtar has strongly criticised the new penal code introduced in Taliban-ruled Afghanistan that permits domestic violence against women. He raised concerns about the legal sanctioning of abuse and its far-reaching implications for women's safety and rights.

Hrithik Roshan's tribute to mentor MM Baig: You helped me find my way Hrithik Roshan has shared a heartfelt message following the death of his former teacher, MM Baig. He highlighted the impact Baig had on his early years as an actor.

Allu Arjun hosts cocktail bash ahead of Allu Sirish-Nayanika wedding. Guest list Allu Arjun's brother, Allu Sirish, is set to marry Nayanika Reddy on March 6. The wedding celebrations have officially begun with family members coming together for a special cocktail party.

Alexandra Daddario, Andrew Form split after three years of marriage Actor Alexandra Daddario and her husband Andrew Form have called it quits after three years of marriage. The couple will continue to co-parent their 15-year-old son.

Jeh Ali Khan's 5th birthday: Kareena-Saif host Naruto-themed party Jeh Ali Khan, the younger son of Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan, turned five on February 21. The family marked the special occasion with an intimate Naruto-themed birthday celebration.

Stop spreading baseless news: Sargun Mehta refutes pregnancy rumours Actor Sargun Mehta responded to ongoing speculation regarding her pregnancy and called out baseless rumours circulating for the past two years. In a statement on social media, she emphasised the importance of verifying information before making assumptions.

Why did Anurag Kashyap call up 'bade papa' Trump? Check out viral video to know In a viral video, filmmaker Anurag Kashyap is seen making a call to a man resembling US President Donald Trump. Their hilarious conversation centres on Kashyap's new film Kennedy.

Accused trailer: Konkona-Pratibha play same-sex couple in psychological-thriller The trailer of director Anubhuti Kashyap's Accused, shows Konkona Sen Sharma and Pratibha Ranta playing a same-sex couple. The psychological-thriller focusses on public perception around a sexual misconduct allegation.

Eric Dane's final message to his daughters revealed: Overall, we had a blast Grey's Anatomy actor Eric Dane died at 53 following a battle with ALS (Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis). He had recorded an interview few months before his death, in which he addressed his teenage daughters.

KH X RK: Rajinikanth-Kamal Haasan recreate retro vibes in gangster themed promo The announcement video of Rajinikanth-Kamal Haasan's KH X RK was released on February 21, 2026. The promo shows both icons in a retro look.

Rajpal Yadav attends niece's wedding after bail, expresses gratitude to wife Rajpal Yadav attended his niece's wedding after being granted interim bail in the cheque bounce case. In an emotional statement, he expressed gratitude towards his wife.

Assi box office collection day 1: Taapsee Pannu's film opens on decent note Taapsee Pannu's crime-drama, Assi had a slow opening on its first day. The film, directed by Anubhav Sinha, also features Kani Kusruti, Revathy, and Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub.

How Johnny Depp eased Eric Dane's financial burdens before his death from ALS Johnny Depp supported late actor Eric Dane by reportedlly providing a rent-free Los Angeles home during his final months. The Grey's Anatomy star died on Thursday at the age of 53 following a 10-month battle with ALS.

Mitti over metro: Heartland stories emerge as Indian OTT's bestseller genre India's OTT platforms are witnessing a surge in hinterland-themed shows that highlight regional stories and authentic rural life. In this week's Cinematic Saturday, we explore how this shift reflects audiences' desire for relatable content rooted in their own cultural and social realities.

Never lets me feel burden of relationship: Taapsee Pannu on husband Mathias Boe Actor Taapsee Pannu has shared candid insights about husband Mathias Boe, revealing the one condition she had before marriage and what truly makes him special.

Eric Dane's final interview now streams in Netflix's 'Famous Last Words' Eric Dane opened up in a powerful Famous Last Words interview, sharing reflections on regret, resilience and legacy that leave a lasting impact.

R Madhavan says Dhurandhar stars broke down after 26/11 scene R Madhavan reveals how Akshaye Khanna and Arjun Rampal reacted after filming the 26/11 sequence in Dhurandhar -- and why the moment changed everything on set.

Pavane review: Moon Sang-min leads a tepid romance that never quite soarsRelease Date:Fri Feb 20, 2026 Netflix's Pavane is a slow-paced romance set in Seoul's department store. The film explores subtle emotional connections but struggles to gain momentum.

general news.headline: Assessing implications of US tariff ruling, steps announced by Trump: GovernmentThe Government of India is reviewing the implications of the US Supreme Court's ruling that termed President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs illegal.

2 IEDs found in Punjab and Kashmir after Lashkar Delhi terror plot warningThe development comes on the heels of security agencies warning of a possible terror plot by Pakistan-based Lashkar targeting religious and tourist spots in Delhi.

Karnataka BJP MLA caught red-handed taking Rs 5 lakh bribe, arrestedThe complainant, Vijay Pujar, a Class-1 contractor from Gadag, approached the anti-corruption authorities after he was allegedly asked to pay Rs 11 lakh to secure necessary clearances for the project.

50%, 25%, 18%, 10%? Clearing the air on India Trump tariffs after court orderDonald Trump has said the India-US tariff arrangement, as per the trade deal, will remain intact. However, the White House has clarified that Indian goods will be charged 10% tariff for now. We help clear the confusion for you.
AI will not kill Indian SaaS, but will make it bleed with 1000 cutsThe rumours that Indian SaaS is dead are greatly exaggerated. But it also doesn't mean that pain is not ahead.

Einstein's spinner? No, Usman Tariq is not pausing. It is all relativityT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq spoke at length about his much-debated bowling action, saying he doesn't pause before delivering the ball, but moves slowly. If they are not able to start before then, we are expected to have a wash-out.

Shirtless Congressi banners ft Gandhi come up amid protests in Delhi, ChandigarhThe row over a shirtless march by the Congress during the AI Summit in Delhi escalated on Saturday as Youth Congress members held protests in several cites and clashed with the BJP in Indore. The BJP also held counterprotests, waving black flags at Rahul Gandhi and burning his effigy in UP.

Shikhar Dhawan marries girlfriend Sophie Shine in private ceremonyFormer India cricketer Shikhar Dhawan married Sophie Shine in a private ceremony on 21 February. The duo had been dating for over a year and were first spotted together in February 2025.

Congress's shirtless protest at AI Summit inspired by Nepal's Gen Z: PoliceDelhi Police told a court that the shirtless Youth Congress protest against PM Modi at the AI Summit was part of a larger conspiracy allegedly inspired by Nepal's violent Gen Z movement.

UP couple get death for sexually abusing 33 minors, selling videos on dark webWhile delivering the verdict, the Pocso court, termed the case "rarest of the rare" and said Ram Bhavan and his wife Durgavati's crimes were based on "unparalleled depravity".

Social good, human capital: Over 75 nations sign Delhi Declaration on AI impactIn a statement on Saturday, the External Affairs Ministry said that over 85 nations and international organisations, including the European Union, the US, and the UK, have adopted the Delhi Declaration on AI impact.

South India to see heavy rain from Sunday, North to witness hot daysA low-pressure system in the Bay of Bengal is set to trigger rain across South India this Sunday. In contrast, North India will stay dry with temperatures expected to soar above 30 degrees Celsius.

Trump given options to kill Khamenei and son in targeted Iran strikes: ReportUS President Donald Trump has been briefed on military options that include a targeted strike against Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei and his son Mojtaba Khamenei, Axios reported, citing senior administration sources.

He didn't like India at first. Now he has travelled across it 12 timesMasashi Mitsui is a Japanese photographer who is currently undertaking his 12th motorcycle journey across India. But what keeps drawing him back, time and again?

Iran can sink US aircraft carriers, says Khamenei. What weapon can it use?Iran's Supreme Leader, Ali Khamenei, stated the country possesses a dangerous weapon capable of sending US aircraft carriers to the bottom of the sea. While he did not mention the exact weapon, Iran does possess a vast arsenal of hypersonic and subsonic missiles that it could use against US warships, should need arise.

The British woman who turned against her own empire for India's freedomCharlotte Despard publicly denounced British imperial rule from London in the 1920s. Her activism linked women's suffrage with India's fight for independence, challenging imperial authority and inspiring global solidarity.

I worry for people who worry about Abhishek Sharma's form: Suryakumar YadavT20 World Cup 2026: Speaking to the press in Ahmedabad on the eve of India's Super 8s match against South Africa, captain Suryakumar Yadav played down concerns about Abhishek Sharma's lean patch. The World No. 1 T20I batter has not managed to get off the mark in the tournament, managing three ducks in as many matches.

Live: How difficult was CBSE Class 10 English Exam?CBSE Class 10 English Exam Analysis 2026 Live: The detailed analysis of the CBSE Class 10 English board exam is now available, offering a clearer understanding of the paper's structure and difficulty level. Expert reviews suggest that the English Communicative paper was balanced with most students able to complete it within the allotted time.

sports.headline: BCCI announces support for Cricket Association for the Blind in India The BCCI has announced a structured support framework for India's visually impaired cricket teams, offering travel, accommodation, and venue access to boost exposure, infrastructure, and inclusive growth in the sport.

Quinton de Kock has revealed that the cricketers, till date, do not speak of that day.

Shikhar Dhawan marries girlfriend Sophie Shine in private ceremony Former India cricketer Shikhar Dhawan married Sophie Shine in a private ceremony on 21 February. The duo had been dating for over a year and were first spotted together in February 2025.

Mandhana, Patil hand Australia 1st T20I series defeat after 10 years at home India secured a historic bilateral T20I series win over Australia at Adelaide Oval with a 17-run win. The victory ended Australia's streak of seven successive T20I series win.

OK Google, teach me how to bat: Shubman Gill shares tips with Sundar Pichai Shubman Gill gave Google CEO Sundar Pichai a batting masterclass at Google's Gurugram office, explaining how to play the short ball using wrists and hips instead of arm extension.

Suryakumar backs Abhishek, explains Tilak's role ahead of Super 8 vs South Africa T20 World Cup 2026: Speaking to the press in Ahmedabad on the eve of India's Super 8 match against South Africa, captain Suryakumar Yadav spoke about India's batting tempo so far in the tournament, Abhishek Sharma's lean patch and Tilak Varma's role. Listen in!

India's FIH Pro League woes continue, lose 1st match of Hobart leg 0-2 to Spain Spain piled on the misery on India as Craig Fulton's side slipped to their fifth straight loss in the FIH Pro League on Saturday, February 21. This was India's first match in the Hobart leg of the Pro League.
Hope Jos Buttler brings out his best in Super 8s: Harry Brook Here is the full excerpt from England captain Harry Brook ahead of their game against Sri Lanka in Kandy.

AUSW vs INDW: Mandhana breaks 6-year-old record as India post 176 in 3rd T20I Smriti Mandhana smashed a record-breaking 82 to help India post 176/6 in the third T20I against Australia. She got involved in a century stand for the second wicket with Jemimah Rodrigues to bring India in the driver's seat.

Kerala Blasters face ISL uncertainty after GCDA dispute over JLN Stadium rentA stadium rent dispute has once again put Kerala Blasters in a difficult spot ahead of their ISL home fixture. With the pre-match press conference blocked, uncertainty now surrounds operations at Kochi's JLN Stadium.

Is Surya not a fan of Super 8s pre-seeding? Captain ducks bouncer in AhmedabadT20 World Cup: India captain Suryakumar Yadav has hinted that he is not a fan of the ICC's pre-seeding system for the T20 World Cup. The skipper was asked about the much-debated issue on the eve of India's Super 8 match against South Africa in Ahmedabad.

England's Jacob Bethell enjoying Australia's early T20 World Cup exit: Good to seeT20 World Cup: England's Jacob Bethell could not resist a cheeky dig at Australia after their group-stage exit from the T20 World Cup 2026. While England moved into the Super 8s, their Ashes rivals were left to reflect on a campaign that unravelled quickly.

No Pakistan players in the Hundred? Will be a shame: England captain Harry BrookT20 World Cup: England captain Harry Brook said that it would be a shame to see Pakistan players get snubbed during the auction for the upcoming season of The Hundred this year. The four IPL-owned franchises are reportedly planning not to buy Pakistan players during the auction.

ICC's T20 World Cup pre-seeding: Australia's Adam Zampa not a fan of ideaT20 World Cup: Adam Zampa admitted that he isn't a fan of ICC's pre-seeding system during the T20 World Cup. Zampa also reflected on Australia's campaign in the ongoing tournament, expressing disappointment at their early exit from the tournament.

Abhishek vs Markram: Ex-India star flags opener's biggest threat vs SAT20 World Cup: Ahead of India's Super 8 clash against South Africa, Aakash Chopra warned that Abhishek Sharma must navigate smart match-ups rather than chase big shots. With Ngidi in form and Markram an option with the new ball, tactics could define the contest.

Jonathan Trott successor's duty station will be in Afghanistan: ACB chiefACB chief executive Naseeb Khan has said that the new Afghanistan coach and Jonathan Trott's replacement will need to be based out of the country during his tenure. Khan also said that the process to find the new coach is underway.

Mayweather does retirement U-turn, to return to pro-boxing after Mike Tyson boutFloyd Mayweather Jr. has completed a retirement U-turn, saying that he wants to return to pro-boxing after his exhibition bout against Mike Tyson. Mayweather retired in 2017 and is now aiming to extend his unbeaten run.

Benfica's Prestianni admits anti-gay slur at Vinicius, denies racist abuseBenfica winger Gianluca Prestianni reportedly admitted to using a homophobic slur at Vinicius Junior while denying racist abuse. UEFA's investigation is ongoing, with severe disciplinary consequences possible if discriminatory conduct is confirmed.

PAK vs NZ, Weather report: Will rain put Pakistan under early Super 8 pressure?Pakistan and New Zealand will meet in their first T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8 match in Colombo, where both teams need improved performances after inconsistent group stage showings. However, will rain put early pressure on Salman Ali Agha and his men?

South Africa will expose under-pressure India: Coach Conrad ahead of Super 8 clashT20 World Cup: Ahead of the Super 8 rematch in Ahmedabad, South Africa coach Shukri Conrad suggested that defending champions India will carry heavier pressure. With both sides unbeaten, he believes expectation could become the decisive factor.

Another year, same story? Why Arsenal may be bottling Premier League title againArsenal's title race seems to be faltering again under pressure from Manchester City, a familiar script that their fans have become accustomed to. With 11 games left, including a trip to City, will Arteta and his men remain as bridesmaids once again?

Australia cares about Tests more than T20Is? Adam Zampa shuts down notionAdam Zampa has shut down the notion that Australia cares more about Test cricket than T20Is after their exit from the T20 World Cup 2026. Australia failed to advance from their group and qualify for the Super 8 stage.

Watch: Abhishek Sharma fires up India teammates before Super 8s clash vs SAT20 World Cup: Runless so far in the tournament, Abhishek Sharma sparked India's Super 8 build-up with a rousing Punjabi war cry in Ahmedabad. As South Africa await, the team has publicly backed the young opener despite his lean patch.

Pakistan face familiar New Zealand test to kickstart Super 8s in ColomboT20 World Cup Super 8s: Pakistan face New Zealand in a crucial T20 World Cup Super 8s match in Colombo on Saturday. Babar Azam is under pressure as both teams look to bounce back from mixed group stage campaigns.

Pakistan having psychological advantage over New Zealand? Mike Hesson opens upT20 World Cup 2026, PAK vs NZ: Speaking to reporters, Pakistan head coach Mike Hesson discussed whether Pakistan holds the upper hand ahead of their Super 8 clash against New Zealand. Historically, Pakistan have defeated the Black Caps in five of their seven encounters in the tournament.

T20 World Cup: India bowling coach Morkel defends 'tacky' Wankhede, Motera pitchesIndia bowling coach Morne Morkel has come out in support of the curators at the Wankhede Stadium and the Narendra Modi Stadium in Motera, backing their efforts after the slightly tacky surfaces at both venues drew scrutiny during the T20 World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
